title: TBH, I'm in Shock These 15 Hair Tools Are Still Available From Nordstrom's Anniversary Sale
description: You won't want to miss these.
author: Maya Thomas
excerpt: You won't want to miss these.
text: Since I was raised in the rainy, overcast state where Nordstrom has its roots (Washington), knowing how to shop for the best beauty deals during its exciting annual Nordstrom Anniversary Sale is part of my DNA. In fact, I believe the smart shopping gene runs in my veins, and I happen to have one of the few careers that lets me share my superpower of finding discounted beauty must-haves during the 26-day savings event. This time around, from July 12 to August 3, shoppers have access to a selection of the best products at jaw-dropping prices, and I already have my eye on a few standout hair tools that deserve your attention.Blow-dryers, curling irons, and more are already landing in my virtual shopping cart, so I'm taking this opportunity to share the ones that caught my eye. Keep scrolling to discover the hot tools that I'll be adding to my daily hair routine for glossy, smooth, and long-lasting styles. Pro tip: Bookmark these for easy access!Best Hair Tools, ListedFlat Iron: Bio Ionic 10x 1-Inch Styling IronCurling Iron: GHD Soft Curl 1 1/4-Inch Curling IronHot Roller: Drybar The Roller Club Hot RollersWaver: Mermade Double Hair WaverBlow-Dry Brush: T3 Airebrush Blow Dry BrushHair Dryer: Dyson Supersonic Nural Hair DryerFlat Irons Bio Ionic 10x 1-Inch Styling Iron To kick things off, why not try this lightweight iron with an ergonomic design? This one uses vibrating plate technology infused with Volcanic RockMX to separate and condition strands throughout styling, ensuring hair is smooth and polished. GHD Chronos Styler 1-Inch Flat Iron Another flat iron I've had my eye on is this GHD find. It has ceramic floating plates coated with an ultra-gloss finish with a reengineered wishbone hinge with a sleek, rounded design ideal for easy-glide styling. Dyson Airstraight Wet-to-Dry Straightener Going from wet to dry in seconds isn't hard with this Dyson straightener. It reduces time spent drying and styling for a sleek, straight finish on multiple hair types using glass bead thermistors, a powerful motor, and lock feature. Curling Irons For bouncy, Hollywood-level curls, snag T3's CurlWrap Curling Iron. It has a two-way AutoTwist switch for breezy barrel steering, nine heat settings, and two smart timer options for stunning styles that are long-lasting and frizz-free. ghd Soft Curl 1 1/4-Inch Curling Iron If you like soft, windswept curls, the GHD Soft Curl 1 1/14-Inch Curling Iron might be your best bet. Featuring ultra-zone technology, ceramic-coated plates, and a temperature of 365°F, this hot tool locks in your curls with even heat. Bio Ionic 1.25-Inch Long Barrel Styling Iron Long barrels like the one on this Bio Ionic iron are key for creating effortless curls and waves. Its extended length makes it easy to style long hair (or the back section on shorter styles), and it's infused with NanoIonic MX to quickly form your dream style. Dyson Airwrap ID Multi-Styler and Dryer Straight+Wavy Hair If you ask any beauty editor for their go-to hot tools, there's a good chance Dyson's multi-styler will be mentioned. Designed with straight and wavy hair in mind, it dries and styles strands using intelligent heat control and static-reducing negative ions. Hot Rollers and Wavers Drybar The Roller Club Hot Rollers I'l admit it—I'm late to the hot-rollers club. Now that I'm here, however, I don't see myself leaving anytime soon. These ones by Drybar stand out to me because they use cool-touch rims for easy styling and a quick-heating base to create defined curls. If you've wished you could change the size of a curling iron's barrel without trading up tools, try the Switch Kit Wave Trio. It has two different-size barrels and a wand with nine heat settings for precise styling across all hair types and textures. Mermade Double Hair Waver Not everyone can get windswept, mermaid waves from spending endless days on the coast, but The Double Hair Waver offers the same look. It uses advanced intelligent heat technology and ionic ceramic plates to create effortless, heat damage–free waves. Blow-Dry Brushes and Hair Dryers T3 Airebrush Blow Dry Brush Ideal for creating flawless waves and salon-level blowouts, T3's Airebrush Blow Dry Brush combines the powers of IonFlow Technology and ion-enriched airstream. Plus, it has digitally controlled heat for polished results on all hair types. Drybar The Double Shot Blow-Dryer Brush Another Drybar find I've been itching to buy is the Double Shot Blow-Dryer Brush. Using Ionic Technology to reduce frizz and add a lot of shine, it also has strategically placed vents for maximum airflow and three temperature settings. T3 Afar Travel Size Hair Dryer I'm on the go this summer, so I'll be grabbing this travel-size hair dryer. Its auto dual-voltage design, T3 IonAir Technology, and six heat and speed combinations offer fast drying power when time is of the essence. It also has a stowaway folding handle for easy packing. Dyson Supersonic Nural Hair Dryer Dyson's Supersonic Nural Hair Dryer belongs in everyone's hot-tool lineup. This one helps maintain the scalp's moisture levels and hair's shine by your scalp barrier from extreme heat. It also prevents overdrying for healthy, smooth strands. T3 Featherweight StyleMax Dryer I've taken more breaks while drying my hair than I'd like to admit using traditional hair dryers, but that's not the case for this lightweight option. Optimized for all hair types with four attachments and modes, it defines and elevates your style. Maya Thomas is an Associate Beauty Editor at Who What Wear. Her strong love for all things beauty and fashion stems from a strong childhood interest in the fine arts. During a gap year spent in Paris studying the history of French fashion, she shifted her focus to English literature and journalism as a student at Loyola Marymount University. After graduating in May 2021, Maya began freelancing for Parade.com as a contributing commerce writer. When she's not writing, Maya spends her free time catching up on reading, perusing art galleries, and enjoying a night out at the ballet every now and then.
html:
Since I was raised in the rainy, overcast state where Nordstrom has its roots (Washington), knowing how to shop for the best beauty deals during its exciting annual Nordstrom Anniversary Sale is part of my DNA. In fact, I believe the smart shopping gene runs in my veins, and I happen to have one of the few careers that lets me share my superpower of finding discounted beauty must-haves during the 26-day savings event. This time around, from July 12 to August 3, shoppers have access to a selection of the best products at jaw-dropping prices, and I already have my eye on a few standout hair tools that deserve your attention.

Blow-dryers, curling irons, and more are already landing in my virtual shopping cart, so I'm taking this opportunity to share the ones that caught my eye. Keep scrolling to discover the hot tools that I'll be adding to my daily hair routine for glossy, smooth, and long-lasting styles. Pro tip: Bookmark these for easy access!

Best Hair Tools, Listed

  • Flat Iron: Bio Ionic 10x 1-Inch Styling Iron
  • Curling Iron: GHD Soft Curl 1 1/4-Inch Curling Iron
  • Hot Roller: Drybar The Roller Club Hot Rollers
  • Waver: Mermade Double Hair Waver
  • Blow-Dry Brush: T3 Airebrush Blow Dry Brush
  • Hair Dryer: Dyson Supersonic Nural Hair Dryer

Flat Irons

Bio Ionic

10x 1-Inch Styling Iron

To kick things off, why not try this lightweight iron with an ergonomic design? This one uses vibrating plate technology infused with Volcanic RockMX to separate and condition strands throughout styling, ensuring hair is smooth and polished.

GHD

Chronos Styler 1-Inch Flat Iron

Another flat iron I've had my eye on is this GHD find. It has ceramic floating plates coated with an ultra-gloss finish with a reengineered wishbone hinge with a sleek, rounded design ideal for easy-glide styling.

Dyson

Airstraight Wet-to-Dry Straightener

Going from wet to dry in seconds isn't hard with this Dyson straightener. It reduces time spent drying and styling for a sleek, straight finish on multiple hair types using glass bead thermistors, a powerful motor, and lock feature.

Curling Irons

For bouncy, Hollywood-level curls, snag T3's CurlWrap Curling Iron. It has a two-way AutoTwist switch for breezy barrel steering, nine heat settings, and two smart timer options for stunning styles that are long-lasting and frizz-free.

ghd

Soft Curl 1 1/4-Inch Curling Iron

If you like soft, windswept curls, the GHD Soft Curl 1 1/14-Inch Curling Iron might be your best bet. Featuring ultra-zone technology, ceramic-coated plates, and a temperature of 365°F, this hot tool locks in your curls with even heat.

Bio Ionic

1.25-Inch Long Barrel Styling Iron

Long barrels like the one on this Bio Ionic iron are key for creating effortless curls and waves. Its extended length makes it easy to style long hair (or the back section on shorter styles), and it's infused with NanoIonic MX to quickly form your dream style.

Dyson

Airwrap ID Multi-Styler and Dryer Straight+Wavy Hair

If you ask any beauty editor for their go-to hot tools, there's a good chance Dyson's multi-styler will be mentioned. Designed with straight and wavy hair in mind, it dries and styles strands using intelligent heat control and static-reducing negative ions.

Hot Rollers and Wavers

Drybar

The Roller Club Hot Rollers

I'l admit it—I'm late to the hot-rollers club. Now that I'm here, however, I don't see myself leaving anytime soon. These ones by Drybar stand out to me because they use cool-touch rims for easy styling and a quick-heating base to create defined curls.

If you've wished you could change the size of a curling iron's barrel without trading up tools, try the Switch Kit Wave Trio. It has two different-size barrels and a wand with nine heat settings for precise styling across all hair types and textures.

Mermade

Double Hair Waver

Not everyone can get windswept, mermaid waves from spending endless days on the coast, but The Double Hair Waver offers the same look. It uses advanced intelligent heat technology and ionic ceramic plates to create effortless, heat damage–free waves.

Blow-Dry Brushes and Hair Dryers

T3

Airebrush Blow Dry Brush

Ideal for creating flawless waves and salon-level blowouts, T3's Airebrush Blow Dry Brush combines the powers of IonFlow Technology and ion-enriched airstream. Plus, it has digitally controlled heat for polished results on all hair types.

Drybar

The Double Shot Blow-Dryer Brush

Another Drybar find I've been itching to buy is the Double Shot Blow-Dryer Brush. Using Ionic Technology to reduce frizz and add a lot of shine, it also has strategically placed vents for maximum airflow and three temperature settings.

T3

Afar Travel Size Hair Dryer

I'm on the go this summer, so I'll be grabbing this travel-size hair dryer. Its auto dual-voltage design, T3 IonAir Technology, and six heat and speed combinations offer fast drying power when time is of the essence. It also has a stowaway folding handle for easy packing.

Dyson

Supersonic Nural Hair Dryer

Dyson's Supersonic Nural Hair Dryer belongs in everyone's hot-tool lineup. This one helps maintain the scalp's moisture levels and hair's shine by your scalp barrier from extreme heat. It also prevents overdrying for healthy, smooth strands.

T3

Featherweight StyleMax Dryer

I've taken more breaks while drying my hair than I'd like to admit using traditional hair dryers, but that's not the case for this lightweight option. Optimized for all hair types with four attachments and modes, it defines and elevates your style.

Maya Thomas is an Associate Beauty Editor at Who What Wear. Her strong love for all things beauty and fashion stems from a strong childhood interest in the fine arts. During a gap year spent in Paris studying the history of French fashion, she shifted her focus to English literature and journalism as a student at Loyola Marymount University. After graduating in May 2021, Maya began freelancing for Parade.com as a contributing commerce writer. When she's not writing, Maya spends her free time catching up on reading, perusing art galleries, and enjoying a night out at the ballet every now and then.
